Chappell, Simon P wrote:
> We're having some "robust" discussions about testing here and one of the 
> big issues concerns correct nomenclature for testing types and levels 
> and scopes. Does anyone have any book recommendations to help with 
> industry accepted terms and definitions? I have seen references to "The 
> Art of Software Testing" by Glenford Myers that describe it as the 
> seminal work on the matter. Is that book worth getting? Is there a 
> website anywhere that has "standard" definitions that my co-workers and 
> I can use for enlightenment on this matter?
> 
> All wisdom on this matter will be greatly appreciated.

Here's wisdom that nevertheless doesn't help you: it doesn't matter. If 
they're getting hung up on what words mean in some ethereal objective 
sense, rather than simply finding a workable vocabulary to help with 
their current discussion, then I have to wonder whether they care about 
communicating at all.
